content:
/>
XI.ii.3.C.3.c
.
When to Deny Accrued or Substitution Claims Without Development
It is not required to issue development when
accrued benefits do not exist
there is a lack of legal eligibility
the claim lacks merit, or
the claimant is not entitled to the benefit as a matter of law.
Reference
:  For more information on VA’s duty to assist, see
M21-1, Part I, Subpart i, 1.A
.
title: M21-1, Part XI, Subpart ii, Chapter 3, Section C  - Development for Accrued and Requests for Substitution
citation: Part XI, Subpart ii, Chapter 3, Section C
